Source code for maxairesources.ensemble.ensemble

import pyspark.sql.functions as F
import pyspark.sql.types as T
from functools import reduce
from pyspark.ml.functions import vector_to_array
from pyspark.sql.functions import lower, col, when
import statistics
from pyspark.sql.functions import udf, col
from pyspark.sql.types import StringType
from pyspark.sql.functions import expr
from operator import add
from pyspark.sql.window import Window

from maxairesources.logging.logger import get_logger
logger = get_logger(__name__)


[docs]class Ensemble(object):
    
    def __init__(self, base_models):
        '''list of base models to be passed'''
        self.base_models = base_models
        

[docs]    def predict(self, data, col = "", method = ""):
        for i in self.base_models:
            cols = data.columns
            data = i.predict(data)
            data = data.select(*cols, col)
            if method == "soft":
                data = data.withColumn(col, vector_to_array(col))
                data = data.withColumnRenamed(col, "prob_" + i.__class__.__name__)
                cols = data.columns
            if method == "hard":
                data = data.withColumnRenamed(col, "pred" + i.__class__.__name__)
                cols = data.columns   
        return data

        

[docs]    def VotingClassifier(self, data, method = "hard", weight = None, threshold = 0.5):
        '''
        Input -- TestData, Method of ensemble to be used, List of weights
        Sample Input -- VotingClassifier(testData, method = "soft", weight = [0.2,0.8], threshold = 0.5)
        Note - The cummulative sum of the weight list should be fun
        VotingClassifier - Consists of three ensemble methods - hard, soft, weighted soft
            Hard Voting - We will calculate the mode of prediction across all the classifiers, and provide the Combined Prediction label as the output
            Soft Voting - Here if the user doesn't enter the weights, we will calculate the uniform average of probabilities across all the classifier outputs, and return Average Probability Column as the output.
            Weighted Soft Voting - Here if the user enter the weights, we will calculate the weighted average of probabilities across all the classifier outputs, and return weighted Average Probability Column as the output.
        '''
        method = method.lower()
        if method == "soft": 
            if weight is None: 
                logger.info("Ensemble Voting [Soft] Classifier Initiated")

                data = self.predict(data, "probability", method = "soft")

                logger.debug(f"{data.columns} Probabilistic predictions received")

                @F.udf(T.ArrayType(T.FloatType()))
                def avg_array(array1, array2):
                    return list(map(lambda x: (x[0] + x[1]) / 2, zip(array1, array2)))

                prob_cols = ["prob_" + i.__class__.__name__ for i in self.base_models]
                data = data.withColumn(
                    "probability", reduce(avg_array, [F.col(x) for x in prob_cols])
                )
                
                data = data.withColumn('class_0', col("probability")[0])
                data = data.withColumn('prediction', F.when(col('class_0') > threshold, 0.0).otherwise(1.0))
                data = data.drop("class_0")
                
                data = data.drop(*prob_cols)
                logger.info("Ensemble Voting [Soft] Classifier Completed")
                return data
            else:
                if sum(weight) != 1.0:

                    logger.info("Incorrect weights passed")
                    logger.debug("Sum of weights should be 1") 

                logger.info("Ensemble Voting [Weighted Soft] Classifier Initiated")

                data = self.predict(data, "probability", method = "soft")

                logger.debug(f"{data.columns} Probabilistic predictions received")

                prob_cols = ["prob_" + i.__class__.__name__ for i in self.base_models]
            
                for i in range(len(weight)):
                    data = data.withColumn("weight_col",F.lit(weight[i]))
                    data = data.withColumn(prob_cols[i], vector_to_array(prob_cols[i]))
                    data = data.withColumn(prob_cols[i], expr("""transform({},x -> x*weight_col)""".format(prob_cols[i])))
                
                @F.udf(T.ArrayType(T.FloatType()))
                def sum_array(array1, array2):
                    return list(map(lambda x: (x[0] + x[1]), zip(array1, array2)))

                data = data.withColumn(
                    "probability", reduce(sum_array, [F.col(x) for x in prob_cols])
                )
                data = data.withColumn('class_0', col("probability")[0])
                data = data.withColumn('prediction', F.when(col('class_0') > threshold, 0.0).otherwise(1.0))
                data = data.drop("class_0")
                
                data = data.drop(*prob_cols)
                data = data.drop("weight_col")
                logger.info("Ensemble Voting [Weighted Soft] Classifier Completed")
                return data   
            
        if method == "hard":
            df = data
            data = self.predict(data, "prediction", method = "hard")
            df = self.predict(df, "probability", method = "soft")
            prob_cols = ["prob_" + i.__class__.__name__ for i in self.base_models]
            w = Window().orderBy(F.lit('A'))
            df = df.withColumn("idf", F.row_number().over(w))
            df = df.select("idf", *prob_cols)
            data = data.withColumn("idx", F.row_number().over(w))
            data = data.join(df, df.idf == data.idx, "inner")
            logger.debug(f"{data.columns} Predictions labels received")
                
            def mode(*x):
                try:
                    return statistics.mode(x)
                except statistics.StatisticsError:
                    return x[-1]
                
            pred_cols = ["pred" + i.__class__.__name__ for i in self.base_models]
            prob_cols = ["prob_" + i.__class__.__name__ for i in self.base_models]
            
            mode = udf(mode, StringType())
            data = data.withColumn("prediction", mode(*[col(c) for c in pred_cols]))
            
            @F.udf(T.ArrayType(T.FloatType()))
            def avg_array(array1, array2):
                return list(map(lambda x: (x[0] + x[1]) / 2, zip(array1, array2)))
            data = data.withColumn(
                "probability", reduce(avg_array, [F.col(x) for x in prob_cols])
            )
            
            data = data.drop("idf","idx")
            data = data.drop(*pred_cols)
            data = data.drop(*prob_cols)
            logger.info("Ensemble Voting [Hard] Classifier Completed")
            del df
            return data

    


[docs]    def VotingRegressor(self, data, method = "average", weight = None):
        '''
        Input -- TestData, Method of ensemble to be used, List of weights
        Sample Input -- VotingRegressor(testData, method = "soft", weight = [0.2,0.8])
        Note - The cummulative sum of the weight list should be fun
        VotingRegressor - Consists of two ensemble methods - soft, weighted soft
            Soft Voting - Here if the user doesn't enter the weights, we will calculate the uniform average of predictions across all the regressor outputs, and return Average Prediction Column as the output.
            Weighted Soft Voting - Here if the user enter the weights, we will calculate the weighted average of predictions across all the regressor outputs, and return weighted Average Prediction Column as the output.
        '''
        method = method.lower()
        if method == "soft": 
            if weight is None: 
                logger.info("Ensemble Voting [Average] Regressor Initiated")

                data = self.predict(data, "prediction", method = "soft")

                logger.debug(f"{data.columns} predictions received")

                @F.udf(T.ArrayType(T.FloatType()))
                def avg_array(array1, array2):
                    return list(map(lambda x: (x[0] + x[1]) / 2, zip(array1, array2)))

                pred_cols = ["pred" + i.__class__.__name__ for i in self.base_models]
                data = data.withColumn(
                    "prediction", reduce(avg_array, [F.col(x) for x in pred_cols])
                )
                data = data.drop(*pred_cols)
                logger.info("Ensemble Voting [Soft] Classifier Completed")
                return data
            else:
                if sum(weight) != 1.0:
                    
                    logger.info("Incorrect weights passed")
                    logger.debug("Sum of weights should be 1") 

                logger.info("Ensemble Voting [Weighted Average] Regressor Initiated")

                data = self.predict(data, "prediction", method = "soft")

                logger.debug(f"{data.columns} predictions received")

                pred_cols = ["pred" + i.__class__.__name__ for i in self.base_models]
                
                for i in range(len(weight)):
                    data = data.withColumn("weight_col",F.lit(weight[i]))
                    data = data.withColumn(pred_cols[i], vector_to_array(pred_cols[i]))
                    data = data.withColumn(pred_cols[i], expr("""transform({},x -> x*weight_col)""".format(prob_cols[i])))
                
                @F.udf(T.ArrayType(T.FloatType()))
                def sum_array(array1, array2):
                    return list(map(lambda x: (x[0] + x[1]), zip(array1, array2)))

                data = data.withColumn(
                    "probability", reduce(sum_array, [F.col(x) for x in pred_cols])
                )
                
                data = data.drop(*pred_cols)
                data = data.drop("weight_col")
                data = data.drop(*pred_cols)
                logger.info("Ensemble Voting [Weighted Soft] Regressor Completed")
                return data
